titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Genevieve Earle poem and photograph 1981.006
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-19 17:58:49 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection contains a poem written by Genevieve Earle to her nephew, Joseph K. Lane, on his 21st birthday, and one photograph of Earle standing on the steps of a home in Tupper Lake, N.Y. Genevieve B. Earle (1883-1956) was head of the Brooklyn branch of the League of Women Voters, and was the first woman elected to the New York City Council.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Joseph K. Lane, 1973. Formally accessioned in 1981.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Genevieve B. Earle (1883-1956) was head of the Brooklyn branch of the League of Women Voters, and was the first woman elected to the New York City Council, where she served as minority leader.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Genevieve Earle poem and photograph, 1981.006; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files (ARC.315), Series 1: New York City and Long Island, Folder: Organizations -- League of Women Voters
Records of the Brooklyn Council for Social Planning (BCMS.0039), Series 7: Related non-government agencies, Subseries 7.5: Other related agencies, Folder: League of Women Voters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a poem written by Genevieve Earle to her nephew, Joseph K. Lane, on his 21st birthday, and one photograph of Earle standing on the steps of a home in Tupper Lake, N.Y.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
